author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In yon Rus' realm, the seeds of mut'ny sown,
The glutt'rous Wagner Group gnawed Putin's throne,
Beneath that crown, unease and questions grew,
As men did marvel how such frailty slew.

Low tides tugged at the dollar, green and worn,
By tow'ring rates and weak growth tempest-torn,
Yet, though she stumbled, raised by analysts' hand,
From plunging depths to narrow, safer land.

Bold oil doth climb the mast of rising risk,
When Wagner leashed may break the chains, and whisk,
From Russia's grumbling lands, new threats to wend,
And in those murky shadows, peace upend.

feedItems.title: Latest Updates on Russia After the Mutiny
feedItems.description: After the Wagner Group’s mutiny showed the unexpected fragility of President Vladimir Putin’s regime, key questions remained unanswered.

feedItems.title: Dollar Edges Lower But Economic Concerns Should Limit Losses
feedItems.description: The dollar edged lower as markets calmed after last week’s bouts of risk aversion due to concerns about interest rates, inflation and weak growth, but analysts expect these factors will limit the currency’s falls.

feedItems.title: Oil Gains After Wagner Mutiny
feedItems.description: Oil prices edged cautiously higher after an aborted mutiny in Russia added to geopolitical risks, and “the market will likely have to start pricing in a larger risk premium for oil given the growing instability in Russia,” ING said.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In Grecian lands, a victory grand,
Mitsotakis holds in his noble hand,
With pride, as prime minister he'll stand,
Once more to guide the Hellenic band.

Brace well thy heart for a week of trial,
As metal prices mix with coin's denial,
Across Europa's lands, the markets vile,
Gold edges higher, yet shadows smile.

In Rus, a tempest brews, full of woe,
Wagner's chief, Yevgeny, doth show,
His might pulled back, from a strife to grow,
Moscow's war averted, 'tis thus we know.

feedItems.title: Greek Conservatives Score Decisive Election Win
feedItems.description: Kyriakos Mitsotakis, head of the conservative New Democracy party and Greek prime minister for the past four years, is expected to be sworn in Monday for a second term.

feedItems.title: Metal Prices Mixed Ahead of Light Data Week
feedItems.description: Base metals prices were mixed and gold edged higher in early trading, with sentiment still weary about the wider economy, and ANZ highlighted poor manufacturing data in Europe and in particular Germany last week adding pressure to markets.

feedItems.title: What's Happening With Wagner in Russia?
feedItems.description: Wagner chief Yevgeny Prigozhin pulled back his forces from the brink of a bloody clash with the Russian army in Moscow that threatened to plunge the country into civil war.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In Wagner's chief doth discord rise,
Prigozhin's cause 'gainst Putin rears,
Motives dire, courtiers' ties,
Fierce ambition, strife, and fears.

In golden Sintra's forum gleams,
The Eurozone awaits its cue,
Inflation tests, monetary schemes,
The bonds of nations there renew.

Thus, in Russia's weekend of strife,
The fate of Wagner doth persist,
As whispers of a hidden knife,
Both Putin and Prigozhin resist.

feedItems.title: Why Wagner Chief Prigozhin Turned Against Putin
feedItems.description: Military infighting, financial pressures and personal political ambitions played into the brash decision.

feedItems.title: ECB's Sintra Forum, Inflation Data Seen Driving Eurozone Bonds This Week
feedItems.description: The key events for eurozone government bonds this week are likely to be the euro area inflation release and the ECB’s forum in Portugal where “investors will scrutinize for guidance on monetary policy,” UniCredit Research said.

feedItems.title: After Weekend of Chaos in Russia, Questions Remain Over Fate of Wagner
feedItems.description: With both Vladimir Putin and Yevgeny Prigozhin silent, Russians and Western officials wonder whether the crisis is truly over.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of AB Foods and profits eke,
An outlook bright and fair they speak,
Primark's rise, a summer's tale,
As bounteous harvests swell the ale.

Yet woe betides Siemens' loom,
A profit warning doth their doom,
Like murky ale, their stock decline,
For Gamesa's future no man define.

Now praise be sung for Hyundai's gain,
A contract they hath won, 'tis plain,
In distant sands of Araby,
Like sweetest wine their fortunes be.

feedItems.title: AB Foods Lifts Profit Outlook
feedItems.description: Associated British Foods said it expected its full-year adjusted operating profit moderately ahead of last year’s after Primark posted a 13% rise in third-quarter revenue, boosted by higher selling prices and well-received summer ranges.

feedItems.title: Siemens Energy's Profit Warning Dents Investor Confidence
feedItems.description: Siemens Energy’s profit warning has dented investors’ confidence not solely because of the difficult-to-quantify risks related to fixing past deliveries, but also due to the lack of visibility at Gamesa, Citi said, downgrading the stock to neutral.

feedItems.title: Hyundai E&C Advances After $5B Saudi Contract Win
feedItems.description: The South Korean builder’s shares rose after it secured a contract to build a petrochemical complex for Aramco’s Amiral project.
